intro: Neolloydia pseudomacrochele, commonly known as the narrow-leafed neolloydia, is a rare and enigmatic member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats, such as woodlands or stream banks. Its morphology suggests adaptations for wind pollination, with small, delicate flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanically significant species for ecological studies.
